page.title: 18A Striking family
page.content: I can remember when my dad went on strike. I was walking to school and he was walking home from the pit.He said, "We are going on strike."At that moment I didn't really take it serious. My dad knew this was his last wage so he went to the D.H.S.S. to get a benefit.We were allowed Â£20.30 to live on Â£3.60 of which was for my special diabetic diet.My parents were in debt having to pay bills in small amounts. My mum worried about being able to pay the dinner.Of course we were helped by the family,vouchers from the union and the church.My dad got a decent meal provided by the Women's Action group and I was allowed free school dinners. Apart from some difficult times our family managed quite well through the strike.{* by Karen Dawson *
